column1: on a length outside off, worked through midwicket. Not well timed
drags it down too short and allows the batsman to rock back and pull it from low down and beat short fine leg
smashed. Sits up again, and he goes well back and unleashes a powerful pull. Threw his bat at it mightily, and sent it soaring over deep square leg
better length this time, on the fifth stump, cuts to point
fuller this time, and he goes down to sweep. There is a man at deep square
good length, turning into him from outside off, moves across and clips it wide of mid-on
movement away from the right-hander on a length, defended back. Got it quite high on the bat, with the bounce more than he expected perhaps

lovely bit of swing bowling. Deepak Chahar's wicket-taking ways continue. Beautiful line, length and movement. Simmons' feet are rooted in cement and he drives away from the body, gets a nice thick edge that goes comfortably to slip.
swings into him this time, but too far down leg. It's a wide but it shows Chahar is swinging it both ways again. Danger signs for batsmen.
lovely. Another outswinger. Very full this time, and he tries to drive from the crease, gets a thick edge that floats through point
yorker length, bunted down to mid-off for a quick single
movement again, but this is in the slot and wide outside off, so King frees his arms and has a thrash at it, smears it through covers for a boundary
length ball, nipping away but pitched on leg, tucked backward of square
length on the stumps, clipped through the legside

good length on leg stump, tries to flick it away but misses. The ball rolls off the pad to short fine leg. Bhuvneshwar is interested but that was probably pitching outside leg. Replays confirm it did.
length outside off, glided to third man.
keeps it on a tight length and line, bunted to mid-on and they take a quick single. A direct hit might have had him in some trouble, but he was quick off the blocks.
nipping in off the seam but too short, and he hoicks a pull through midwicket. Came off the bottom half of the bat.
length outside off, slowed it up a bit. Slaps it to cover, not timed.
stunning. Not that short, on leg though, and he stays still, swivels and pulls it with a strong bottom hand. Gets plenty of meat on it, sends it over fine leg
superb from Lewis. Got a hint of room outside off, stayed on the back foot and cuts it fiercely through point. Shorter than Chahar would like to bowl
too short again, and well outside off, so he'll have to re-bowl that
angled into him from wide of the crease around the wicket to deny him room, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on a fourth stump line, pushed to extra cover
hammered. Too short from Chahar, sits up on off and allows King to swivel back and pull this over deep square leg
better length, fuller and on middle and off, moving away a touch, but he stays inside the line and pushes to mid-off for a quick single
and there is the short ball that is effective! Puts his back into it and well targetted, on off stump, forces the batsman to sway out hurriedly

slower ball, pushed to mid-off, too early into the shot and it hung in the air, but bounced in front of the fielder. Kohli there, who unleashes a throw and scores a direct hit at the striker's end - but the batsman is well home
too full outside off, driven powerfully from the crease, but can't beat extra cover
rolls his fingers over it again, and bowls it very full. Too early into the shot again. Pushed to mid-off
too much room outside off and that's just flayed over deep point. Saw the width, and went hard at it, frees his arms very nicely and gets a lot of meat on it to send it up and over
slower ball, but the radar was off, length on leg stump, and he goes inside the line and flicks it fine to collect another boundary
length outside off, spins into him, he goes back and flat bats a pull to long-on
smoked. Tossed up outside off, inviting the drive. Lewis accepts but executes it so well, the bowler doesn't have a chance. Takes a stride out and frees his arms to send it soaring over cover
too short outside off, cuts it well but straight to point

got him, beaten on the sweep. Washington tossed it up nicely on off - bravely even, given what had happened earlier - and Lewis was moving across to sweep. Misses and is struck - but that looked like the impact was outside off!. He hasn't reviewed it though. Will that prove costly for West Indies? To be fair, it looked very much in front in real-time.
length ball fired into him, goes back and flicks it off his hip to fine leg
fuller, takes it on the front foot and turns it to short fine leg
beaten! Jadeja got this to grip and turn, defeats the batsman's attempted turn down to fine leg, flies off the pad over slip
shorter, goes back and cuts, but straight to point
fuller, comes forward and pats it to long-on
flat on the stumps, goes deep and whips it between mid-on and midwicket
length ball outside off, was giving himself room to slash it, but the ball came on quicker than he thought and he ends up bunting it back off the toe end
shorter, goes back and pulls to long-on's left
clipped through midwicket
superbly executed. Down the track, the bowler saw him and pulled the length back, but he still managed to flay it over extra cover for a boundary
too far down leg.

valiant attempt by Rahul at long-on but he can't hold on. Too short, and he goes back to leather a pull to long-on. Rahul runs in and dives forward and to his right, but can't quite reach the ball. He went for the catch, so couldn't stop the boundary
shorter length outside off, cuts through point
floated on a length on off, Hetmyer takes a big stride out and steers it with an open bat face and soft hands to backward point for a quick single
extra bounce does him in. Too short and he was looking to pull it again, but misses it completely as it goes over his bat
another one. Not timed well but he's still managed to clear deep midwicket. Full outside off, he lifts it off the back foot, gets well underneath it and reaps the reward
too short, outside off, cuts it through cover
fired into him, he's giving himself room but is tucked up, manages to clip it through midwicket
too short again, well outside off, he goes back and cuts it to deep point
fuller on off, steered to point
starts off with one well outside off, Hetmyer gives himself room too and cuts it to point
that's just leathered over deep midwicket. Hetmyer's power to the fore. Googly outside off, very full, but he still sweeps it with power and precision over the boundary
fuller, comes forward to turn it but gets a leading edge towards mid-on
too short, but well outside off, cuts to deep point
down the track, Chahal spots him and bowls it into the blockhole, he flicks it away to deep square
birthday wicket! Drops this length ball outside off stump, and King gives the ball a chase. Too wide for him as it turns even further away, and Pant swiftly whips the bails off
full on off, and tapped with soft hands into the leg side. They scamper across for one
back of a length, wide outside off, and Hetmyer allows the ball to turn inwards before pulling past wide long on
wide length ball once again. Hetmyer tries to play the late cut, but can't beat short third man
appeal for caught behind but not given. They discuss but choose not to review. This was a short ball he tried to cut but couldn't connect
full, from around the wicket. Ends up as a low full toss. Nudged off his toes to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, and flicked away to deep midwicket for a comfortable single
back of a length, outside off, and Pollard shimmies across the stumps before dragging a pull to the cow-corner fence. Not quick enough to trouble the WI captain with the short ball
short again, and Pollard is quick to swivel into the pull. Top-edged but enough power to clear deep backward square leg
back of a length, outside off, but Pollard walks into the shot. Guides it away to deep midwicket for a quick single
full, on off, and he presses forward to defend it back to the bowler
back of a length on off, and he bends his knees before clattering a pull to the sweeper-fielder on the leg side
length ball from around the wicket, cramping the batsman for space. Nudged off his hips to square leg
length ball, outside off, and fended off the back foot
good length on off, and he allows the ball to angle in. Flicked to the leg side
fullish, outside off, and he tries to flay a cut. Finds point
that's outta here! Quicker ball, full on middle, and he's down on one knee to slog-sweep into the second tier. Epic timing...
and that's what Jadeja does, but Virat misfields! Full, wide outside off, and the drive goes through the captain standing at cover. Oh dear!
full on leg stump, and the legbreak turns into his pads. Hits his front leg, but the ball may just have bounced outside the stumps
full outside leg stump, and the slider goes further down leg. Pollard tries to make room by backing away but the ball hits him near the shin
ripper, outside off and turning further away. He attempts the sweep, but the ball whizzes under his bat. Pant can't hold on either
slider, full on middle, but going down the leg side. Pollard is nowhere near any shot, and Pant slides across to intercept the wide
full, on middle, and Pollard simply leans into a front-foot lift over long on. Lazy elegance
good length on middle. Backs away and punches to long on
full on leg stump, and tapped to the leg side for a quick single
full on off and angling across the left-hander. He checks a drive to cover
full and wide, with the ball angling further away. Mistimed to cover, but gets off the strike
good length on middle, and punched off the back foot to long on. They jog across for one
knuckle ball, full on middle, and he mistimes a straight drive to the leg side instead
length ball on middle, and drilled off the back foot to long off
full on middle, and angling into his pads. Worked off his pads to square leg

Washington, what have you done? Length ball on leg stump, and the attempted paddle-sweep takes a top edge. The fielder thinks it's going behind him, so he runs backwards, but the ball falls way in front instead. Everyone's gobsmacked. Maybe the lights messed with his eyes
flatter ball, wide outside off, and flat-batted to wide long off
full and wide outside off, but Hetmyer commits to the shot. Down on one knee, and slapped over long off. His first T20I fifty, can you believe it
full on middle, and he goes for an expansive slog sweep. Mistimed to short fine leg

length ball, outside off and turning further away. Clatters a cut in front of square, and Jadeja cleans up in the deep. Throws it to Pant, but the ball takes an awkward bounce before going over his head. Thankfully, for India, there was someone backing up at deep fine leg
full, on middle, and worked off his toes to wide long on

Washington drops again! Full on middle, and driven straight over Chahar. Washington gets around it from long on, but he drops it while sliding in to take the catch. The ball dribbles away to the boundary, but Rohit dives magnificently to flick the ball back just milimetres from the rope. Two different spectrums in fielding in just one delivery

Rohit slips, then recovers, then takes a one-handed catch, and then releases it as he goes beyond the boundary! Short ball on off, and slapped over the leg side. Rohit - at long on - tries to get under it, but loses his footing. Then recovers to stick his hand out and take a catch, but his momentum takes him over the rope. He was smart enough to release the ball before going over
Rohit drops it again! A hat-trick of reprieves. Full, on off, and hammered with the flat bat. Rohit at long on prepares to catch it, but the ball flies through his palm
short, on middle, and slogged over cow corner! Goes deep in his crease and then hammers it into the second tier. Punishing the Indian fielders now
full ball on off, and worked into the gap on the leg side
back of a length, on middle, and pulled to deep midwicket

Rohit makes amends! Drifter, full on middle, and he slog sweeps rather flat. But Rohit, at deep backward square, was positioned there for that exact shot. Hetmyer out after posting his highest T20I total
full, on off, and turning away. Driven to long off to get of the mark

leg stump dislodged!The googly does the trick. Full on middle, forcing the batsman to come forward, but it slides through the inside-half of the bat before clipping the leg stump. Delightful ball, excellent wicket
good length, on off. Too close to his body for the cut. Played to cover
full, outside off, and driven inside-out over cover. Chahar, at long off, tries to flick the ball back into play, but the ball goes through his fingers
full on middle, and drilled to wide long on. Chahal ends with 2-36
full and wide outside off, and slapped to deep point for a single
full, outside off stump, and he swings through the ball's line to long off
back of a length on middle, and seaming into him. Looks to muscle it leg-side but mistimed to deep backward square leg instead
back of a length, wide outside off, but he does well to drag a pull to cow corner. Kohli runs across the boundary to stop the boundary
in the slot! Full, just outside off, and he clears his front leg before hammering a six over long on
nearly chopped on! Slower ball, length on middle, and he looks to launch it over the leg side. Toe-ends the shot onto his boots, before it rolls away to point

slower ball, wide outside off, and he flat-bats it over the bowler. Kohli, at long off, runs to his right to try and take a catch, and although he gets one hand to it, the ball is dropped. Falls inside the boundary before rolling over for four
overpitched, outside off, and drilled to wide long off
soars over Kohli! Slower ball, wide outside off, and he toe-ends a lofted shot. But Holder's shot has enough power to clear Kohli, the spectator
overpitched on off, and drilled to cover. Couldn't get under it this time
shoveled over Washington at cover, who fumbles again, but recovers well to stop the third. Length ball outside off, and Ramdin opened the bat's face to chip it over the infield
back of a length, outside off, and flat-batted past Bhuvi to long off. They scamper back for the second run to finish on 207 for 5
length ball around off, nipping back in, defended towards the bowler
tight lines, on the fourth stump, he gently chops it to short third man
good length, stump to stump, Rahul wants to flick it but it takes the pad and rolls towards gully. Cottrell runs down and swoops on the ball to prevent any thoughts of a quick single
too full, flicked off the toes to deep square leg
full toss outside off, threw his bat at it and connected well, but straight to extra cover
comes on the front foot and flicks it through midwicket, twirling his wrists. Lewis sprints after it and pulls it back in
terrific timing Bit of width outside off and slightly short of length but Rahul gets into position so nicely and quickly, he's able to execute a rasping cut shot that races through point
brings it closer to the batsman, angling into him, chopped to point
bottom edge goes to fine leg. Not short enough to pull but he goes for it anyway, and gets a bottom edge that goes past the stumps and too fine for any fielder to stop
this is regal. Rahul at his best, stays beside the ball, has the room and the width to cut it, and does so with authority
pulls the length back but the line closer to off, gets  it to bounce more, guided to short third man with a horizontal bat
leans into the off-drive opening the bat face. Point fumbles but recovers and gathers
back of a length on off, dabbed to third man keeping the bat horizontal beside his body
pinged on the glove. Back of a length again, and he was getting into position to pull but it hurried onto him and struck his right hand. Rohit is in some pain
back of a length again on off, Rohit stays beside it this time and slashes it to third man
top edge falls short of short fine leg. No timing on that at all, short ball on leg stump, cramped him for room totally and bounced to the chest, he went to pull it but was too late
through everyone. Superb bouncer, on off stump, quick and rising on target. Rohit is very late on the pull but the ball sails over the keeper's head too
delicate by Rohit. Cottrell went for the bluff, bowling length outside off after a series of short ones had troubled the batsmen, but Rohit was alert to it and late cuts it very fine. Top shot
down leg side, Rahul tries to pull but misses. It'll be a wide
fires in a yorker, that Rohit is forced to defend

picks out the man at deep midwicket! That was superbly played by Rohit, coming down the track and taking it on the half volley, flicking it with great timing. But the placement was awry, and he sends it straight down Hetmyer's throat.
full toss down the leg side, too much for the keeper standing up to gather also
flat and full outside off, pushed to cover
fuller on the stumps, driven with the full face of the bat to extra cover
length on the stumps, tucked off his pads
too short but not enough room, keeping it on the stumps, Kohli punches to cover
rolled his fingers over the ball, and Rahul is forced to check his shot, pats it to the bowler's left
another good short ball outside off and Kohli goes for the pull and can only connect with air.
was there an inside edge on that. Looks like, West Indies not reviewing. That swung in late and hit Kohli in front of the stumps. There were two sounds, and replays confirm an inside edge.
slower ball, pushed back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
good short ball outside off, Kohli moves across and defends it softly into the offside to take a quick single
top edge goes for six. Another short ball, but Rahul is mostly in control of this shot, places it very fine. Doesn't get it off the middle, but has enough on it to carry all the way
stretches his front foot out and works this to mid-on's right
slog slept into oblivion. Too full, in the slot, Rahul goes down on one knee and picks it up from leg stump to smash it
slows it up and keeps it on a lenght outside off, steered to point
spotted the batsman coming down the track and fired in a legside yorker that Rahul can only jam into the legside
fired into him, worked to midwicket
too short, and cracks a cover drive but a diving stop to his right from the man stationed there keeps the runs down to one
fired in quicker. Kohli was giving himself room manages to cut it to point
fuller and Kohli goes hard and straight, clearing his front leg and sending it bullet straight back past the bowler
shorter, and he goes back to cut, but backward point flings himself to his right to stop the ball going through
too short and wide outside off, Rahul twirls his wrists to cut, but there is a deep point. The batsman will feel he's missed out there, that was there to be smashed.
strays down leg and he'll have to rebowl that
given room and width again, which he increases by going back and clearing his leg, cuts it hard to deep point
deftly done. This was fuller outside off and he used the pace to just open the bat face and steer it very fine
saw him come down the track and threw it wide of off, but Kohli managed to get bat on ball, flays it over extra cover
comes on the front foot to work this through midwicket
wants to go over the top and lofts his straight drive but can't time it well, it bounces to long-on
oh that's just bad cricket all around from West Indies. Fires this well down legside and the keeper is also left standing. Five wides
length ball, pushed to cover
that's all brute force and no timing - very unlike Kohli - but he'll get a boundary. Gave himself room and slapped it off the toe end over extra cover
length outside off, steered to short third man
short outside off and Kohli pulls hard to wide long-on.
goes for the yorker angling into him but the radar is off and it's down legside. He'll have to rebowl that
superb bouncer, fooled the batsman who played it too late, went for the pull and missed completely
tried another yorker, ended up a low full toss. Rahul can't connect cleanly and ends up driving it back off the toe end
short of a length, sits up a bit, Rahul waits and swivels to pull it, but there is a deep square leg in place
length outside off, Kohli stays beside it and cuts it to third man. One bounce to the fielder
yorker on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
length ball on off, cuts it from close to his body. Point pulls off another diving save to his right
powerfully cut and this time beats point. Not that wide of off, but his forearms cum into play with a strong slash that fetches him a boundary
length all angling into him, he gets inside the line and punches to long-on
flays this over cover, but there is protection in the deep
length on the stumps, whipped off his pads through midwicket
superb yorker, which he clips through midwicket while off balance
full on middle, and swept behind square. Wants two, but has to settle for one
half-tracker, outside off, and he hammers a cut to deep point. This time they have no choice but to settle for one
nearly chopped on! Back of a length, outside off, and he makes room before trying to pull. Ball stays low, takes an under-edge and whizzes past the leg stump for four. So unlucky!
googly beginning from outside off, but turning in. Too close for the cut, but flayed to short third man nonethelss. They scamper across for one
length ball on off, and turning away. Goes deep and cuts square, but finds the infielder

half-tracker outside off, and flat-batted down the ground. The bowler quickly picks the ball up and tries to run Kohli out at the non-striker's, but the India captain has done the perfect gym lunge to ensure his back foot is inside the crease
slower ball, wide outside off, and he shuffles across - exposing all three stumps - to whip a shot behind square. Hits his pads, and lobs away to the keeper. Uncharacteristic from VK
low full toss on middle, and chipped into the gap in front of cow corner. Rahul's disappointed he couldn't maximise on that delivery
good length ball, outside off stump, but just inside the tram-lines. Kohli wants the wide, but the umpire is firm
top edged over fine leg! Short ball on off, and he swivels with a fast bat swing. Gets enough to clear the fielder on the boundary line. Team hundred too

waist-high full toss, angling into his body, and whipped past the fielder running at deep backward square leg. Kohli is not happy that the umpire has called it a legal ball. The square umpire is Mr Menon, and Kohli suggests that he played it from near his chest, but the reality is that he played the shot way in front of his body. A fifty-fifty call
full, and very wide outside off stump. Wide called
back of a length, outside off, and he rides the bounce before mistiming a flourished shot to mid off
back of a length, outside off,  but it's the slower ball. Slapped down the ground to long off

in the air! But falls just short of square leg on this occasion. Back of a length ball, skidding on, and the attempted leg-side slog is gloved in the air. Falls before King can dive to take the catch. Reprieved...
low full toss on middle, and flicked off his toes to deep midwicket. Gotta settle for one
free hit wasted by India. Back of a length, outside off, and he bends down to try and paddle it over the keeper. But the ball goes over his shoulder and into the keeper's gloves
good length, on middle, and slapped to mid off. They rush across for one as Rahul gets his fifty
yorker, but beyond leg stump. Kohli skips out of the ball's way. Kesrick gives Kohli a stare but the batsman asks the bowler to go back to his run-up. Sparks flying!

slower ball, length on off, and angling in. Tries to pull, but under-edged onto his body. He rushes across for one but complains to umpire Menon that Kesrick Williams was getting in his way. Not the first time today. It's all happening!
Ridiculous! Rahul backs away, exposing all three stumps, but the bowler follows him. Simply swivels and deposits a six beyond deep midwicket
length ball, outside off, and he hammers a flat-batted shot to long on
slower through the air. Full on off, and Rahul gets down on one knee before absolutely creaming a slog sweep over cow corner
long off makes no mistake! Overpitched outside off, and he toe-ends a lofted shot instead. Pollard takes a couple of steps forward from long off and takes a very simple catch. Pierre strikes again
full, on off, and he mistimes a slog-sweep to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. Enough time to jog back for the second
full, outside off, and he drags another slogged shot to deep midwicket. No real timing
what a way to start the innings! Full, on middle, and he hammers a slog sweep over wide long on. Ruins an otherwise excellent over
what. a. shot! Full, in the slot outside off, and he simply checks a lofted shot into the second tier! Long off a mere spectator this time. Fifty for VK
flayed over short third man! Back of a length, outside off, and Kohli opens the bat's face before playing a cut over the infield
attempted yorker, on leg stump, but dug away well to wide long on. Enough time to jog back for the second
very short, outside off, and all Kohli can do is slap this down to long on for one
full and wide from around the wicket. Nearly a yorker, and dug away to point
back of a length on off, and he swivels to pull, but loses his balance in the process. Kohli asks Pant to stay calm from the non-striker's
another wide yorker outside off, and dug down to third man. Keeps the strike
slower ball, full outside off, but he's through the drive too early. Inside-edged to the leg side
Kesrick takes cover! And he gives Kohli the stare after getting hit for four. Full on off, and Kohli drills a flat shot straight over the bowler to the long-on boundary
oye, hoye, hoye! Full, in the slot, and he breaks his wrists to whip this beautifully over wide long on. The crowd goes ballistic
attempted yorker on middle, and guided to wide long on
slower ball, very wide outside off, and hammered past the long-off fielder! Enough power to clear the boundary
full, on off, from around the wicket. Wedged into the gap near mid-on and Kohli forces Pant to come back for the second
full, just outside off, and he whips this to Lewis at deep midwicket. Chance of a run-out if it was a direct hit though...
full on middle, and driven with the bat's open face to extra cover
holes out at long off. Slower ball, full outside off, and mistimed because he's through the shot too early. Cottrell gives the salute to the crowd to celebrate
length ball, angling across, and he plays a late cut to third man for a single
full, on off, and mistimes a drive to Pollard at cover
length on middle, and tapped with soft hands to midwicket for a single. Cottrell runs across and stops the ball, then throws it to the keeper.... but it trickles away for an extra overthrow
full, outside leg stump. Iyer exposes his stumps and then guides a shot to deep midwicket
good length, on middle, and mistimed to deep midwicket
length ball on middle, but going down the leg side
creamed! Full, angling in, and whipped with beautiful wrists over deep midwicket. Gives the bowler a stare too...
good length on middle. Flicked to the leg side for a single. Kohli runs across to the other side with wobbly legs like Mr Bean

full on middle and angling down leg. Tries to flick, but misses. Hits his pad and rolls away. Pollard reviews for lbw after the umpire says no. Replays confirm that the ball pitched in line but would've missed leg stump. West Indies lose a review
length ball outside off, and Kohli drills a shot to wide long off. Wanted two, but Iyer didn't see the captain's call

takes a stunner! And then celebrates like a boss. Good length outside off, and Iyer flat-bats a shot back to the bowler's left. But he dives on the followthrough and stretches both hands out before taking a spectacular catch. Folds his arms and then points to the skies above. A rare failure for Iyer
full, on middle, and bunted to wide long on. They scamper back for two
magnifique! Full, outside off, and he goes inside-out over cover for six! Kohli is pumped. Mutters something to himself before punching his own bat in aggression. Team 200 too
full, outside off, and he comes down the wicket before driving to wide long off for another couple

speechless! And that's his highest T20I score as well. India win, and he pumps his fists in delight. But what a classy way to end the match. Full, outside off, and he checks a glorious drive over long off to hit the final nail in the coffin. Proceeds to remove his helmet, stands in the middle of the pitch, and then raises his arms so that the crowd can enjoy the moment too. India win by six wickets
